item.title: Propositional Logic
item.description: Conditional statements You will encounter most if not all of the following ways to express this conditional statement: “if p, then q” “if p, q” “p is sufficient for q” “q if p” “q when p” “a necessary condition for p is q” “q unless ¬p” “p implies q” “p only if q” “a sufficient condition for q is p” “q whenever p” “q is necessary for p” “q follows from p”
